s2.title: SAXCount
s2.p: SAXCount is the simplest application that counts the elements and characters of a given XML file using the (event based) SAX API.

s3.title: Building on Windows
s3.p: Load the &XercesCInstallDir;-win32\samples\Projects\Win32\VC6\samples.dsw Microsoft Visual C++ workspace inside your MSVC IDE. Then build the project marked SAXCount.

s3.title: Building on UNIX
s3.p: This will create the object files in the current directory and the executable named SAXCount in '&XercesCInstallDir;-linux/bin' directory.

To use the validating parser, use
Here is a sample output from SAXCount
s3.source: cd &XercesCInstallDir;-linux/samples/data SAXCount -v personal.xml personal.xml: 60 ms (37 elems, 12 attrs, 134 spaces, 134 chars)
s3.p: Running SAXCount with the validating parser gives a different result because ignorable white-space is counted separately from regular characters.
s3.source: SAXCount personal.xml personal.xml: 10 ms (37 elems, 12 attrs, 0 spaces, 268 chars)
s3.p: Note that the sum of spaces and chracters in both versions is the same.
s3.note: The time reported by the program may be different depending on your machine processor.
